Description: Lower body with splaying wall and handle root of Chian pottery mug; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black save lowest wall and floor; two added white bands; exterior reserved save for band of paired hook maeanders pattern between pairs of lines brown bands on lower wall and two more bands below; underside slightly concave, slipped and reserved.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA 113 (with a less pronounced base). According to Williams' typology (1983, 178), the mug fits into his Type A and into Boardman's (1967, 126) Type B. Boardman, J., Excavations in Chios 1952-1955. Greek Emporio. Annual of the British School at Athens Supplement 6. Oxford 1967. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1923) (phase 2)
